NecQeXhFJCyYHevnnbsU7Q.text: They portion size was very little the food wasnt that good and the lady was kind of rude.

Kx_YYJoaOp6qeQuoZMsuJA.text: Big Hengs is the underdog restaurant you can't help but love and look forward to coming back for more.  Granted, as most others have mentioned, they place is anything but sexy. However who cares?  The food quality and quantity is as good as it gets.  The prices are so cheap I guarantee you'll do a double take.  The staff is some of the nicest I've ever met, and the atmosphere is interesting to say the least.  It only took my very first dining experience at Big Hengs to give them the crown!  Everything is good, but my favorite is the Walnut Shrimp.

9tD7GHZLcBA9URU4_VI62A.text: I have been to this place at least 50 times over the course of my life. My parents used to take us here (4 kids) and get the hunan dinner for four.  The reason why this restaurant keeps us coming back and has me referring all of my friends is because you get a big bang for your buck. That, and the food is outstanding. Try the sesame beef and the emperors chicken. It is seriously to die for. I am in North Phoenix now so I spend a little extra drive time, but it is worth the drive. I love that it hasn't changed and it doesn't need to. It is my favorite little hole-in-the-wall! BTW, I was just reading reviews on Yelp to see about trying a new fun restaurant for Valentines day. I typed in Big Heng just to see what people think about it. LOL  If you don't like Big Heng, then I don't like you :D

ieNrgovqBttV6Oo6VofGNQ.text: I have been going here for over 15 years, you get a lot here for your money.  It is a better deal than any other restaurant like it.  You can feed your whole family of 4 for under $20 with ease.    I love that they offer free hot tea, it is always good plus, and most of their lunch specials are just $5.45 and come with soup, rice and a lot of food, so much that I am usually stuffed when I leave.    As is custom with most Asian places, they have a separate menu for dinner, that is about 50% more pricey.  But don't feat they have dinner specials for $8 that are almost twice as big as the lunch ones, so big that we usually split just one and then order a large side of rice and a small appetizer and our whole family is stuffed, usually with leftovers, and all for way under $20.    Their service is quick once you order, I usually know what I want before I even go inside, so the 5 min or so it takes before they take your order is a bit long.  As soon as you order you get soup, then 2-3 min later your food is there...really just 2-3 min....

kIin4VHzfhdiedX-9n6-CQ.text: Like Taric said, Big Heng is good enough. They give you more than you can eat for spending very little and it truthfully is better than the majority of Chinese around that I tried.   We ordered two lunch specials and they start bringing us piping hot egg drop soup and as FAST AS CAN BE they bring out our lunch entrees.   I thought the hunan chicken was better than the Szechwan Chicken. That Szechwan sauce was mild and flat to me and the vegetables were mostly celery and green peppers but the canned bamboo shouts in this dish bothered me because I kept tasting can.  Like I already said the hunan chicken was better and I might have given four stars if this was the only dish I tried. The sauce was better, the vegetables in this dish were better, this dish did have heat to it.  Both meals had a nice vegetable to meat ratio and both were piping hot and everything seemed fresh.  Big Heng close to Tolmachhoff Farms so you might want to check them out if you stop by here.  3.5 stars

zWGh91MV09_U63r9i4JYAQ.text: I have been eating here since I first moved to Peoria (I was in 3rd grade... so the late 90s?) and it is STILL my favorite Chinese restaurant. Every time I get Chinese, I compare it to Big Heng and I have never found anything comparable.   Some of my favorites: Teriyaki Chicken, Sesame Chicken, Garlic Chicken, Curry Chicken, Orange Chicken. The egg drop soup is the BEST. The PuPu Platter is so good (I love the beef skewers). They have the best egg rolls. Seriously the best. Crab puffs are amazing (they actually have crab in them, what a concept) and the best pork fried rice.   I used to ditch 4th period (I went to PHS) every few weeks and go to Big Heng with my boyfriend.   I have since moved away (first to Flagstaff, then Queen Creek and now living in Goodyear) and we still make the drive at least once a month to eat here.   They do use MSG in their cooking, which is the ONLY reason I give them 4 stars instead of 5.  The food is cheap, fast and it is always delicious. Lunch (served 11-3 I believe) is probably the best value (my SO and I can eat here during lunch for about $12) but dinner is great. The specials are more expensive at dinner, and limited, but you can sub the entrees for a fee.

GBovte1nBY4M1TZY_iLGQQ.text: Obligatory ENG101 assignment; however, my feelings are genuine and I do love Big Heng.  ___    Everyone has been at a point when they just wanted some good, cheap food. Maybe they cannot be bothered to cook or they are on a lunch break, still their desire is simple: to quell their hunger and to satisfy the palate.  People in the Glendale and Peoria area would be happy to know that there is a charming, hole-in-the-wall place to satisfy their needs. Big Heng is the go-to Chinese restaurant due to its affordability, service, and, of course, the food. Big Heng is a family owned, Chinese restaurant located on 75th and Peoria that has been open for over twenty years. It is open every day for lunch and dinner for dine-in and takeout. It offers Pepsi products and alcoholic beverages as well. Many locals have gone so far as to say that it is the best Chinese restaurant in town. One Yelp reviewer had said that they "have tried different Chinese restaurants over the past year or so but they always falter somewhere along the line.  Whether it be in food quality or service....or both, Big Heng is still the best around!" (P., Vinnie).    Most people want to be able to go out to eat without breaking the bank, but this restaurant is so cheap, it is available to anyone. All lunch items are available for less than six dollars. Lunch includes a large, piling plate of food with a choice of white or fried rice, an egg roll, and the entree. The rice is fluffy and light, and the egg roll is crispy, yet moist on the inside. Additionally, guests are also served a cup of egg drop soup with wontons on the side.  With so much food for such a low price, this restaurant has an excellent value that would make patrons feel that they had gotten their money's worth.        The wait staff of any restaurant can either make or break a guest's experience, and Big Heng's staff will be sure to provide excellent service. Big Heng has some of the friendliest staff in the area. The ladies there will absolutely come to know their customers and their families. They are absolute sweethearts; they are incredibly nice, polite, and treat guests as their friends. They will even ask their regulars where their usual dining companion is if they are missing. On top of being so personable, they have incredible customer service. The staff has such quick service that customers can expect to have their lunch in less than five minutes. Guests shouldn't worry about asking for anything because the staff is sure to have already taken care of it or have asked if anything was needed. They are also very knowledgeable about all their items and, if asked, will even give customers advice on how to cook their own Chinese food at home. The staff of Big Heng puts many restaurants to shame and should be the standard for waiters.        Naturally, the main focus of Big Heng is, of course, their delicious food. The restaurant offers food for every palate and diet. Big Heng prides itself in its variety of Chinese fare; it has Mandarin, Szechwan, Hunan, and Cantonese cuisine. Of these dishes, there are vegetarian, Kosher, and healthy options. The food tastes special; it is like the dishes are not easily replicated and that it can only be found there, yet it tastes oddly familiar and comforting. It is a very unique dining experience.The food- appetizers, main course, and the sides- are all well-seasoned, carefully cooked, and has great flavor. Unsurprisingly, with food like that, it leaves guests satisfied and coming back. The sesame chicken is a particular favorite of many guests; the chicken is perfectly breaded, dulcified in a sauce with an impeccable blend of sweet and savory, and is topped off with toasted sesame seeds. If chicken is not a particular favorite for someone, there are beef, shrimp, and pork dishes as well. The Lo Mein is well seasoned and the noodles are the right consistency, not too chewy or flimsy; it is what a noodle should be. The variety of Chinese cuisine offers amazing flavors and displays the talents and passion of the kitchen.     As great as Big Heng is, if there was one thing that could be improved, it would be its atmosphere. Admittedly, the ambiance is not great; it is located in a shady strip mall- the kind of strip mall with a rundown laundromat and questionable looking bar- and the inside is a bit tacky. The decor is cheap and passe; it is not exactly the type of place to have a nice date at. However, looks are not everything and it should not deter guests away. Sometimes it's the ugly oysters that produce the shiniest pearls, or it's the ghetto restaurants that have the best food.      Big Heng is an excellent Chinese restaurant that boasts an affordable price, excellent staff, and delicious, varied food. Considering the generous portions, it is a great value that manages to be of quality. Everyone in the Glendale and Peoria area should give Big Heng a visit to experience their unique, affordable Chinese cuisine and wonderful wait staff.

oaitbFZnn9cS6FSX6PKfGg.text: I used to eat here all the time growing up. Since then I've lived in Southern California and Boston, before moving back here. I don't know if i changed or the food changed, but it completely lacks flavor beyond salt.  We ordered cashew chicken, emperor's chicken, vegetable lo mein, vegetable fried rice, and egg drop soup.  The cashew chicken was drowning in brown sauce that does nothing for it, but it was marginally better than the emperor's chicken.  The emperor's chicken is marked as a spicy dish, but there wasn't a hint of spice or any flavor in the dish.  The vegetable lo mein and fried rice were not as disappointing as the entrees, but they certainly aren't reasons to come back. The fried rice also contained mushrooms which isn't a crime, but worth mentioning for those who don't like them.  The egg drop soup was probably the best item we ordered. I don't have much experience to compare it, but it was a good consistency and a good value.  Sadly, we won't be returning. I've always gotten great service there and I'm happy for their success, but it's not for my family.

Kw-pgSifMXP3MHDsWKKXLA.text: My family and I have been going here for years, but I felt it necessary to review now. Some of the people working there have been working there for years, and I couldn't love them more. Now, food time! If you ever want a mouthblowing flavor mix, try getting the szchecuan anything and an order or orange chicken. The two sauces are like an amazing double dose of awesome in your mouth hole.  I always get an order of egg drop soup when I go. It's a small cup, but it's a perfectly sized appetizer.  Beef and broccoli is solid, egg rolls are on point and every meal so far has been great in it's own way. If you are ever around here, you won't be let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Heng - Peoria, AZ, United States. Beef and broccoli. My baseline for a chinese place. Win.
Photo of Big Heng - Peoria, AZ, United States. Szchecuan shrimp with no vegis. Oh yeah.
Photo of Big Heng - Peoria, AZ, United States. Orange chicken. Orangy and amazing.

hvtBNDoVdgSIsX3NJMJ_sw.text: The only good thing they have is their crunchy noodle and egg rolls. Everything else is lacking seasoning, and flavor. Really hoped to finally have found a good chinese place here is AZ but didn't live up to our expectations.

vC7nhB3OgSm55ERhkfp0gw.text: One of the better Chinese food places in the area. Love their egg rolls. Emperor chicken is good but the curry chicken was kinda weak. Not bad just not great. Always really fresh taste. The food at most local Chinese food joints nearby taste like they have been aging the food in a pile of socks under their bed. Only real complaint is with the fried rice. Powerful weak showing with their fried rice. Step it up Big Hengs.

T7i-6WmjDY-CXiEPLQC5Bg.text: Good food and great prices. Even better customer service.  We have been there a handful of times and have been pleased with our food and the service on each occasion.

HFWu_LFcWSTUCvhZy3zPVw.text: You can either pay $8 at Panda Express for the same old BS, or you can go out of your way to a place like Big Heng and get a crab puff (and oh, their crab puffs are amazing), an egg roll (hell, all their appetizers are freaking good), chicken chow mein, fried shrimp, AND sweet and sour pork. All on one plate. I DARE you to finish a full meal here, because *I* can't, and I'm pretty good at eating.  You will never hear me say Big Heng has the highest quality entrees, but you will hear me say it's good enough, and they give you so much, with a smile, that it's worth it every time.  Seriously, just look at their menu and tell me you can't find something you like.  Thank me later.  PS-If you dine in, get the plum wine!

D5sjUPAu8G37oJ1temuiIQ.text: Let's keep it simple. It's really good! Get the Mongolian beef and any lo mein. You'll be glad you did.

P7W7TDLdoY1I0FBVFOztoQ.text: This place is FAST, delicious and priced right. They are so friendly in the restaurant or take out. I love the orange chicken and crab puffs. If you order take out a lot, they throw in extras. I can't force myself to try any new Chinese places though because I know it won't be as good.

ZvgvJbx98N_ubxeSA2MVjQ.text: It was alright. The lo mein was very good. The orange chicken was actually kind of gross! It tasted like something you buy frozen in a bag. The lady who took my order was abrasive and rude, and they have high prices. I probably wouldn't come back here.

B0B39PG-zDPaqcqbA-62Vw.text: So i read most of a reviews and this place seemed promising. First of it looks a bit run down but i do think its family owned. Second, the prices were average but you are not allowed to substitute the rice for lo mein and the lo mein was $7-$9 depending on if you wanted meat or not. Third we got the sechwan beef and the Emperor's chicken both were supose to be spicy and they were far from spicy. The food lacked flavor, unless a lot of salt counts as flavor for you. You could taste the corn starch used to make the chicken crispy and there was more veggies and sauce then beef in the other entree. The food did not taste  very good and i will never go here to eat again and will not recomend to others for sure.

P3nT1ZTAYZIm29KTnbbN1Q.text: Big Hen seemed promising due to the great reviews I had read. I drove here thinking I'd be satisfied! The food here was mediocre. Me and my partner tried the chicken lo mien, sweet sour chicken, egg rolls, and fried rice. Though we didn't really like the above we found the chicken teriyaki, and egg drop soup to be delicious. We came back with two food boxes for the dogs! I'll stick with Cantong Dragon on 75th & Indian school!

K5ZXxM8AaW3s18ydFuQ0hA.text: My family has been visiting Big Heng for about 20 years.  The staff has been the same too.  They know us when we come in.  It is very nice and feels like a family environment.   Service is always quick and the food is always great too.  We LOVE Winnie.  She is the best waitress and  has watched my kids grow up.

jEz3SbSV7uPidCwgc81-HA.text: My favorite Chinese place around here! Great food but not so great service. The place looks clean in the inside but the outside looks deceiving.

QsH9c2Mas8XprFNnjUl5FQ.text: Came to Big Heng's, as I've heard great reviews for mandarin cuisine. Was promptly sat, and waited over 15 minutes for the server to return to take our order. After several attempts of eye contact and waving at other servers/ restaurant employees... We still sat hungry, with our waters. At the 20 minute mark we left, and will never return again.

BT8JCMqrYEPjhGDqp0Kb-w.text: I love coming here for lunch or dinner or even when I just wanna do take out. The food is always Amazing!!!! The people working are typically pretty great too and always trying get what u need or want fast! Everything I have ever tried has been super yum only thing I would say has been not so bueno was on evening trying place phone in orders being put on hold forever was kinda annoying but hey there busy because people luv there food so I get n I'll wait lol its worth it!!

bHcndhan5VSBuoN2m5cgig.text: My family has been coming here for decades. My father brought me here, and now i take my kids,  and everyone I've talked to about this place had loved it to.  I've tried just about everything on the menu by this point,  and so far it has all been great.  And the service is by far great,  fast service and once your order is in your soup comes right out.  Then as your finishing your soup, your food shows up.  Overall i and my family love this place.  Def come in for the lunch specials 11 am to 3 pm is the best bargain.

XqcDPEGDagw-APVOklOGSw.text: Big Heng is a family favorite. Prices are reasonable, service is reliably prompt and staff is cordial. The menu is extensive with varying degrees of "heat." Kung Pao Shrimp with Crab Rangoon, Egg Roll, hot 'n sour soup make a delightful lunch with two or more meals left over. The iced tea flavor prompted me to ask how it is made, "Lipton," I was told.  Groups of diners large and small are welcomed and unrushed.

ftm0aWiub5kZ-McGnozjhA.text: Love this place! Been going here for over 10 years and it's delicious every time. They are good people and go over and beyond to make sure you are happy. Portions are huge and it's half the price of most other places. There isn't anything that I wouldn't reorder! Great work!

mjRho1Mdl52CRA_LJj9zdA.text: So I call in and ask if they have tofu. They say yes. I ask if it's cooked. They say yes. I ask for low mein with tofu on top. She said she couldn't do that. I asked for tofu on the side and just plain low mein, she said she couldn't do that. I had to twist her arm by asking the simple question "are your cooks not competent enough to throw some tofu on top of some noodles?" and she said they were, then she goes on to tell me that if we did that then it would cost 4 dollars more. 4 dollars for tofu. Tofu is cheaper than meat. I asked for the tofu extra crispy THEN she goes "oh yeah we can't do that" so I just asked her to have the cooks cook it longer than they normally do and she said they can't do that. If they literally can't do some really really basic simple stuff like that then that's sad. I hung up at that point and went to good china.

GOFw-501cMNUF-ma3HyOMg.text: I love this place it is my favorite Chinese food establishment to eat at Whiny is awesome.

tRTpIEtpHcug-eFy1Sg-PQ.text: A Favorite for Years!!! Their house lo mein is the best I have ever tasted. I have tried so many other places and this is by far the best! Even though it is a hole in the wall strip mall, it's clean, friendly and well worth the trip. Add some egg rolls and crab puffs YUM!!!

Wn8vUYKhMVUpcHZwsFd0fw.text: Awful! That's the only word I have to describe the food. My brother and I came in and both wanted lemon chicken. He ordered first and then me, they then suggested we not order the same entree? So I had to change my order. I ended up ordering the chicken broccoli dinner plate. When The food arrived, I saw why they suggested to change my order. They were out of the chicken. The lemon chicken looked like breaded chicken patties you get in the frozen food section that was cut up into squares. I've been here before with friends and the lemon chicken never looked/tasted this horrible. The food was not even hot, it was barely warm. My broccoli chicken was chewy. Never ending. It was cold as well. My brother was furious. I barely ate a small section and I always finish food. We boxed up our order and left.. I tried to get my brother to tip at least the minimum but he was so furious about the food that he signed his signature and left.  I will never eat here again. We usually eat at Yan's on 91st Ave & Thomas but wanted to venture out. Big mistake. We are going back to our usual awesome little gem.  Sorry Big Heng, you served us nasty scraps and you know it.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Heng - Peoria, AZ, United States. This chicken broccoli may look good on camera but it was cold and extremely chewy.

aqbuTIXHXpI5WXi-HbaRAQ.text: It was okay, since there isn't really anything else in the area. The portions were very generous and so it was a great value. The egg roll and the crab puffs were very good. I would be tempted if we went again to order just crab puffs, egg rolls and soup! The restaurant was clean, no weird smell (like a lot of older Chinese restaurants seem to have), and they had a nice crowd. However the chicken in the lo mein was all dark meat, the fried rice in the combo didn't have a lot of flavor, and the sweet and sour chicken wasn't coated in the sauce it was just drizzled on the top so some pieces didn't have any sauce - which most of the sauce went to the bottom of the plate and mixed with the lo mein (which didn't taste good together). Also several of the chunks of chicken were a bit rubbery. It's been a few hours since we ate and I feel bloated and very thirsty (so I am assuming a lot of salt is used in the food). I am still on my search for good Chinese food in the west valley. Big Heng is decent in a pinch if you want something edible that won't make you horribly ill, and you like BIG portions... but I wouldn't say it was the best or even very good. It was okay.

wBdL6gNuJ8i116wt9d2UCg.text: We went here tonight for the first time. We were seated at a booth but it was really small. When our server (Winnie was her name) came over she asked if we wanted to move to a more comfortable booth. She was very nice and walked us through a lot on their menu and explained that all of their food is made there homemade. She said a lot of restaurants order egg rolls and potstickers already made but they even make those in house as well. She also told us she has been working there for 20 years. She was very nice and kept checking on us and refilling our water glasses. Excellent service. There were several dirty tables when we came in (8pm) so maybe we just missed the dinner rush. They were busy cleaning all of the tables while we were there and didn't stop which made me feel better. The restaurant is in a small strip mall that is pretty old and you probably wouldn't go there unless someone recommended it just based on the looks of the outside. But on the inside we noticed that it was a very clean, it's pretty plain looking but it is clean even the ceiling tiles for an older building they're all clean and did not have any water stains which tends to happen in older places. We ordered potstickers which you could tell they are made there and they were good, not the best we have had but good. I ordered the Mongolian Beef which again was good but not the best I have had. I am really picky about beef and none of it was really chewy which was good. And the sauce was good. Their portions are large. My husband ordered I think it was the #4 combination plate which had sweet and sour chicken (it was pretty good), fried shrimp (he says they were alright, he's not a huge fan of fried shrimp), low Mein noodles (his favorite of everything we ordered), fried rice (just ok nothing but rice which was darker in color so you know it was fried but there was nothing else in it like eggs, peas, carrots which is what we are used to for fried rice and it didn't really have a lot of flavor). This might not sound like the best review but we did like the food and both said we would go back again. Our bill was $32 with tip so it is not expensive. Oh! And my husband really liked the egg drop soup that came with his meal and Winnie even gave me a cup even though my meal did not come with soup. Winnie gets 5 stars for her service. In our conversation she asked us what our names were and when we left she called us by our names. I am attaching pics of our food.

Photo of Big Heng - Peoria, AZ, United States. Mongolian Beef

Gp04fLJ9vRlqVnrGKtW53w.text: Really enjoyed this place. Had the lettuce wraps, pork chow mien, bijieng beef and emperors chicken.

DwINYa-H9ihTJtp915JG7g.text: Well its kind  Of hard to displease me When It comes to restaurants but the employees ( 2 females always upfront) were absolutely the most disrespectful human beings my mother and I have ever seen!!!  One lady; while I was asking a question had this awful look on her face like she was answering a question from a piece of dog shit! Next my mother asked the other lady politely if she could have a side of hot mustard to go but as My mother tried explaining that she didn't want mustard packets and that she wanted the actual mustard from the kitchen the lady literally turned around and walked into the kitchen while my mother was in mid  Sentence ... Needless to say, it was not correct.... Orange chicken was chewy like rubber and had no flavor except if you like chewing rubber fructose syrup. Anyways the only thing that is decent is the sesame chicken and for that they get 1 star that's it!!!

lIK3z2UEi5mIEs8M4bAA1A.text: We have been eating here since I was younger and it's still the best Chinese food in Peoria! The staff is so friendly and the restaurant is always clean. We dine in often as well as order food to go. When you walk in they remember you and treat you like family. If you are looking for a great experience for family dining this is your place, the food and staff make this establishment perfection! We will continue to eat here for years to come!

zF31jBqoNKo9ayh0LcTT-A.text: First time here.  Very fast, yet pleasant service.  Delicious food.  May be my first choice for a Chinese restaurant.

YQSLnEtJGE50WTOgFPF1wg.text: literally the best shrimp lo mein and customer service ever.

oGMdcVtaBRGm--EO_6YXow.text: This is our new Oriental food place from here on out. Have lived in the area for over a year and wish we had found this back then. The broccoli beef was tender and oh so good as easy the teriyaki chicken, pork lo mien, fried rice, and pu pu plate. Huge amounts of food and enough leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  We will be back for sure.

cxYH7ijd2SUG_prmCEF__w.text: My fiance family has been coming here ever since the moved to Arizona (18 years) & this is my favorite place to go when we are on that side of town! Tons of vegetarian options & good ones at that! Always a pleasure, always perfect whether you get take out or stay. My favorites: -broccoli & mushrooms  -vegetable chop suey -lo mien  -I had the chicken lettuce wraps before going vegetarian, amazing w/hot mustard! -fried rice no egg

UbggWGJWIWfRGf5kDAnRiw.text: I've been coming here for almost a decade. Fast and friendly service always. My favorites include the house chicken, beef chow fun, and emperor's chicken.

FmqRLDNf-jMT4qt4_c050Q.text: Visited big hengs tonight for a to go order. Walked in and ordered egg rolls and crab puffs....im pregnant and thats what i was craving. The order came out very quick not even the 10 minutes she said it would be. I drove not 2 blocks to eat my food and it was as if my food had been sitting in a window or came back from someone elses plate, there was a nasty staleness to them and nothing was even close to hot. Mind you this was a busy friday night around 6:30 -7ish when no food should be left sitting like that even if it wasn't busy...who serves food like that! So disappointed!

4DUlsfhTfRpYeJV6gZ35yg.text: Been going here for years. Love it. They haven't changed up their food at all.  I like knowing exactly what I'm getting when I order. They are quick and friendly.

fCtV2HKWh3Zk4Fu8IAQSNg.text: One of my favorite genuine Chinese restaurants for a great deal on a nice amount of food close to my work!  Great service at dine in and fast with to-go orders.  It is hard not to eat here every week!

WGiivLrxNDVc4gXcrqbOoQ.text: Daughters kept braving - Simone if our family dinners we ordered. 6 adults and 5 kids and we ate for around $40 AND IT WAS DELICIOUS ! Have eaten there 3X since and NEVER disappointed.

VPboDsn8v7j5C6-Jm9V8sw.text: This place has been a life long favorite that has never let me down in quality, customer service,  and cleanliness. I always get that "right at home" feeling each time I go here. Always refer everyone to go here and anyone I have brought here has left with a new favorite of their own.

PVd1tn1dm-342nHs-vhTVg.text: This place was ok don't think I will come back but it was pleasant experience:  The orange chicken is overwhelming sweet, and it over took the flavor of the chicken. The rice was good and the broccoli beef was ok too. They had Pepsi products but they also had can coke which was awesome. The service was friendly but the food was not as good as I was hoping. Guess I will continue to search for a good Chinese food restaurant.  The best thing was the chow mein

qvDyOZb47d65jvGkVBvxoA.text: The food here is great, they cook it fast, and the prices exceptional. I will admit sometimes the meat can be a bit "fatty" at times, especially with the teriyaki chicken it can be hit or miss. However overall I do enjoy ordering from here, and the flavor is great. I would definitely recommend you give them a shot. Great experience overall and I've been here a dozen times!

AIeNjjqU6d_jNalEnMz69A.text: Not the best Chinese around. We won't be buying again. Mongolian beef was very chewy. Weak flavors. Portion sizes were poor. No free fortune cookies. Cold and dull.

LOYpormlyJFCyOySckrrlQ.text: They don't deliver to us, but this has happily been our go-to place since we moved into the neighborhood!  The portion to price ratio is outstanding and the food is amazing as well.  We always get a gigantic order of the pot stickers because they are the best my household has ever had!

M972jH0bTpxkNrMH63tUGQ.text: Do not order the salt and pepper shrimp it's not full head shrimp they use little shrimps. The service is good the beer prices are cheap. Soup was great rice and veggies were fresh wasn't a big fan of the meat dishes felt they could of used higher grade meat and fresh meat. Ok for basic Chinese restaurant. Prices a little high for the quality of food.

jZS8cfKUSrYePfdkeSl_WA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to give this place a try, since seeing Big heng has great reviews. But in all honesty we were nowhere near pleased, and it saddens me to say I will never go back. We ordered Pot stickers, House Lomein, cup of Hot sour soup, Kung Pao 3 with steamed rice. The Pot stickers are weirdly steamed then stir fried to add the black burn marks around em, quite chewy. My cup of hot sour soup came to me with chips already placed in it, which I found to be odd, and what surprised me more was when I decided to dig in, no pork, no piece of shrimp. Just tofu, juice, and chips. No sour, no spice. I like to eat my chips on the side so they do not get soggy but I didn't send the soup back. The House Lomein was dark, it had a salty burnt taste which upset my boyfriend, he just packed up the noodles didn't bother to take another bite. Now for the Kung Pao 3, that was the only entree we liked. It was a bit salty but I got pass that by drinking it down with a lovely Dr.pepper, which that was a plus. Other than that, I was not to pleased. I suppose this place is not for us.

vX389eLOP_QnQEe8NYPPoA.text: Ugh...finally I always complain when I'm dragged to this place..too much gross food for such a lil price...people you must not be stuck in a lil world of big hen..venture out ..

ydl1VkiDpi8DzK1hN01eYA.text: This dive delivers!  The best chinese food that I have had in the valley.  Prices are ridiculously cheap, food is awesome and the staff treat you like family once they get to know you.  I love this place.

9I6Ee2QuQB8EhSnd18iMdQ.text: Thanks Yelpers! Just moved into this neighborhood and decided to give Big Heng a try. The name alone is enough to get me to eat there, because really, who doesn't love a big heng?  My kids devoured the sweet and sour pork. I like that they put the sauce on the side so the tempura pork is still crispy when you get it home. The egg drop soup was quite flavorful. I like the house fried rice - it's probably just soy sauce and rice really, but it sure did taste good. I've been in Phoenix for 6 years and this is only the second Chinese food experience I've had that made me say, "yes, I'd go there again."  The only thing I didn't really like was that the snow peas in the shrimp with snow peas were a bit soggy. But I can live with that knowing that everything else was a hit with the whole family. And the Dinner for 4 served 5 easily with enough leftovers for lunch for 5.

VRqtt3p0xBFE7hPZch2omw.text: been fan since 1999..  food is always great! and staff is always friendly.. except for this older lady.. she has her moments where she will be yelling at someone in the kitchen.. lol!  same staff since i have known the place..   it might not be the fancy or most attractive looking Chinese restaurant, but you will get plenty of quality food that will satisfy your hunger..         try sesame chicken..  or honey glazed walnut shrimp..  mmm good!

NjmhZZ4s4wGYsA9M5iv38w.text: Great food at really great prices! Two meals for around 20$. And they give you a great portion . Definitely more bang for you buck. Terrific service every time. I highly recommend it. I love it great spot in my favorite town! The Sweet and Sour Pork never disappoints . The atmosphere is always friendly.

kMubTnG59WeJe5ipUVTtjg.text: This place has the best beef and fried rice in the valley, and the second best in the country. It seems to be family owned and operated, with familiar, courteous staff. Dine-in or take some for the road!! Now i'm hungry....

fqX53ORYwovx7dm-dskziA.text: Been here a couple of times now and both times it was awesome.  The first time I had the sesame chicken dinner and today I had the orange chicken dinner.  The sesame chicken is excellent here.  Most places I've had sesame chicken it just taste oily.  Heng's sesame is very sweet, honey-flavored, with a bit of ginger - very pleasant.  As is pretty normal for Chinese restaurants, the orange chicken isn't anywhere near spicy but you can have them spice it up more.  Great crab puffs and fried rice here as well!

p5lCdY-oDBgflMzf7C9AsQ.text: Very good, even after it sitting out for an hour when I got home from work..... Will def order from there again!

ahtTPlheEtJ35A_HYSm0OA.text: I used to love this place and everyone I took with me loved it. Great food and service with reasonable prices. Something important to me was that they always rated very high with their health inspections. However, the last few years they've gone seriously downhill and consistently rate very low with their health inspections. I no longer eat here. I continue to check their health inspections as I hope they'll turn things around and once again be a very clean restaurant.

TNtWO0U8byW0ip7OiJgi7A.text: Soooooooo I used to go to this place was I was a small child and just went there for the first time in about....7-9 years last night. OMG YUM! I love love love their food. I ordered a dinner special (there's 4) and they give you sooooooo much food for $7-8. I got the sesame chicken, fried rice, chicken lo mein, crab puff, and egg roll plate. It also came with egg drop soup. I LOVE egg drop soup, but most places don't make it good. They made some of the best I've ever had. Next time I go, I am just ordering a big bowl of that. Anyway, I had to pay an extra $1.50 because I substituted the sesame chicken for the teryiaki chicken. No biggie, it was still a steal! My BF got the sweet and sour pork with fried shrimp and lo mein and fried rice. He loved it too. He said their hot mustard was the hottest he's ever had.......and then ran a train on it :o) Only thing I didn't like was the bathroom. But hey, who rates a restaurant on that?? It just stunk and was also used as a storage closet. Anyway, if you're out this way, stop in. You'll get amazing food for an unbelievably low price. No wonder they've been in business for 15-20 years.

099NAvACSsl-jz7bsH2eYQ.text: If you like Chinese cuisne and don't have a ton of money to spend, this is the place for you!  The friendly staff keeps the drinks filled and the food is fresh and yummy, dispite the old, tired look of the place. Great lunch specials with egg roll!   If you are thinking of fast food and want to spend $5 on lunch . . . be smart and give yourself a giant upgrade for the same cash, . .  head to Big Heng

TbeS3VA9GJbG3ce7_PQUEQ.text: Wow, how bad is bad! Had chicken chow mein, it was greasy, egg roll soggy, rice was bland, wonton was overcooked.  I have searched for a good chinese restaurant have read reviews and still Im at a loss.  Is there no such thing in this area at all.  Drove quite a ways to try this one as I have many others, guess I will have to give chinese food up completely, just tired of being disappointed.

xvULSkgdI8Odc5pudNS6mw.text: First off, loved this place. It's kind of a hole in a strip mall place but when you walk in, it's clean and everyone is friendly. My friend said she's been going here for years and said it was consistently good. She even had her rehearsal dinner here. Here? I'm kind of a Chinese food snob and didn't expect to like it as much as she did. But I did. The egg drop soup was great-they put a bunch of fried wonton strips on top and sometimes there is bigger pieces of egg white and it is just really good. I had the Hunan chicken, they said it was spicy--and by gum! it was :) And delicious. We had the flat noodles instead of the rice and it soaked up the sauce from the chicken--so, so good. And plenty of veggies with the chicken. My only hesitation is with the egg rolls that were kind of...clunky-almost like they had been made ahead of time and then warmed up. But I'll be back and try all the other goodness they serve. Oh! And it's good inexpensive Chinese food--2 for lunch, tea (a dollar extra) and a bit extra for the noodles vs rice and we got out for $16. Yes, I will be back--and you should go! Trust me :)

r0AlcIsId_81XoZeJELZ5w.text: Been eating here for years! Love it! Cheap prices for big meals. Definitely recommend sweet and sour chicken or teriyaki chicken. Also the egg drop soup and egg rolls!

iTg6Tq_opUHKMgrhX9ktjA.text: First time here and my daughter LOVED IT! Great service, great food nice atmosphere.  Definitely will return anytime I am on that side of town.

dL8uuOwvgl87FTHgOoCrVA.text: WOW.......nice hole in the wall Chinese place.  I loved the food, waitresses are nice and courteous. There is one that is a flirt and funny.LOL  Few things i love here are;  Wor won ton soup, All i can say is wow. Besides this place i don't know what other place serves the Wor won ton soup. i was used to it in Cali.   The house fried rice is the bomb, tasty very tasty.  the wifey loved the the stuffed crab puffs.   The house sweet and sour, very delicious!!!  Beef broccoli, very tasty.  Egg soup is exquisite.   I'm planning to go back and try different dishes, but so far it has not disappointed me.   One draw back but is worth it is its way in Peoria and I'm in east phx, LOL

f6XsfCFZO3ZhTrk4JGSl_Q.text: First time there, and we had  good experience! We ordered for a large party and it was fresh and ready in less than 10 minutes, portions are enormous and very reasonably priced. I am a sucker for chicken fried rice and it was of the best I've ever had! I enjoyed the potstickers, very meaty. My husband got the orange chicken and he felt that the breading could have been crispier, but really enjoyed the flavor. My guess is that it was made fresh and put in to-go containers which may have caused it to steam and soften by the time we got home. I found that the hot and sour soup was oddly too smoky in flavor, but very rich. All in all I am very happy with this experience and can't wait to go back and try other dishes!

OfxhaiyxF7hinMEz9ultfA.text: The food is truly a 3.5 but I rounded to 4 because of the service, portions, and value. I tried to order from Little Saigon several times and it just went to their voice mail. Finally someone picked up but the little bastard said Little Saigon was too busy to take to go orders at the time. So I went on yelp to find somewhere else in a pinch. I have seen this place before and the outside looks really suspect.  I ordered beef and broccoli, chicken and vegetable stir fry, and some crab puffs. Picked it up in 15 minutes. The lady was extremely nice. She gave me some extra hot sauce. Then when I left a tip she seemed as though she was shocked. She said to wait right here and came back with a bag of two free egg rolls. I guess people don't tip often for take out. Anyhow, I told my wife I sure hope the food was good cause I loved that little older lady in there.  Got home and it was pretty tasted. Everything was very hot, fresh, and had a pretty good flavor to it. The only thing I would have changed was a little spicier and a little less sauce but other than that it was great for pick up in a pinch.  Best of all. They gave me enough food to feed a family of five and all for under 20 bucks!! Now that's what I'm talking about. Left over Chinese for lunch tomorrow.

DvtkmfcCteUHqJ73hFbFhQ.text: after eating chinese food in NYC for over 40 yrs. I've spent the last ten looking for that taste. The Big H comes close. So far the Moo Shoo Pork is my favorite, Give the place a try.

Ug8pC_rWW5kpSkw-n91YNA.text: So this place is down the street from where I live and I was super hungry but did not feel like going outside to grill a steak and the rest of my meat was frozen. Dho2BhpG0kecxmlYNE60DA.text: Food is amazing for the cheap prices! Staff is very friendly. Their crab puffs are my favorite

nydzH5OD61xJkJHG-StjBQ.text: If you have a big appetite, Big Heng does not disappoint. The portions indeed are huge. The Yelp reviews here were accurate. I have never been an Egg Drop Soup fan, but because of my daughter's love for this American Chinese creation and the reviews on the soup here, I decided to try the place out. Once again, it did not disappoint. I like this soup so much that I will come back here to carry out this comfort food for sick family members. It was simply delicious. Don't forget to add pepper.  Tonight, we ordered the #1 Dinner Combo with Sweet and Sour Pork, Mooshu Pork Crepes, and Hunan Chicken. They portions are huge. The egg roll was standard American Chinese fare. The Crab Puff was tasty, little crab, lots of cream cheese. The lo mein had a lovely texture, but lacked distinction. The fried rice was okay. The Sweet and Sour Pork had too much batter and the sauce was a dousing of the store bought sauce that they serve with the egg roll. Because of the photographs, I thought the Mooshu Pork would taste more like Peking Duck. The crepe was authentic and so was the sauce that it came with. The filling however was a salty stir-fry of scallions, bean sprouts, fried egg and strips of non-descript pork. Finally, the Hunan Chicken had great ingredients but the gravy was overwhelmingly soya sauce and corn starch. They honored my request for no MSG or Monosodium Glutamate  The servers were fantastic, mostly Cantonese speakers. I felt like I was back in Hong Kong. They were friendly and helpful. When I requested to go boxes, they insisted on packing it up for me. They give me tips on where to get good dim sum. I really wanted to rate Big Heng higher. The service and soup was 5 stars. The rest of the main dishes were on a 2-3 star level. Hence, the 3 star rating. I will definitely return for the Egg Drop Soup.

69L-T3bj57cw1qj21TR1tw.text: We were coming home from our typical SR-89A jaunt through the back roads. We opted to not dine in Wickenburg, and made the decision to wait until we were in town for better food offerings.  Not sure how we happened to decide on dining here.  However, when I am presented with an option, I tend to fixate on it until I am satisfied. This time around, that was a big mistake.  I was driving the convertible this time around, and the ground clearance on this baby isn't much. Lo and behold, the intersection and the sidewalks that lead to Big Heng were all torn up. I found dust, pot holes, gravel, and shallow trenches -  all the things that I try to avoid when driving this particular car.  My wife was kind enough to give me an out. But, like I said, I was already determined to eat here. We pulled into the parking lot of this strip mall, and this is not the best of places to park.   There's Big Heng, a Laundromat, a Pawn Shop, and a neighborhood Bar filled with interesting characters - within and without. Such began the spectacle of trying to maneuver my car into one of the tight parking spaces, while a fair amount of bystanders were wondering who these "fools" were to come here!  We finally were parked. I close the convertible top, turned on the alarm, and made sure that my insurance information was up to date. By this time, we were ravenous. As you can see by our meal selection, we pretty much ordered more food than the two of us could possibly consume.   Our ultimate verdict? Although passable, their offerings were standard fare. There wasn't really anything that stood out, and nothing that gave a lasting impression that wowed our palates and senses. The Mongolian beef didn't have either the sultry spiciness of the hotter variety, nor the savory, smoky sweetness of the sort made with plum sauce. The lo mein was pretty good, but the house chicken would have been better if they'd let us have the sauce on the side. It was too soggy when presented to us. However, the food wasn't expensive, so there was that.  When we used to dine here ages ago, they always had the most interesting and distinctive dishes. This time around, it really left much to be desired. The only satisfying thing about our experience is that we walked away no longer hungry.

767NrANa0qubnlXACW9eEg.text: I have judged the outside of this place since the longest, but today after work I found myself hungry as hell, and the Walmart fish filet wasn't cutting it today.   I went in and was pleasantly surprised by the decor, anyhow, I placed my order based off a yelp photo...(shoutout to the chic who ordered the #7)  and waited about 5-7 minutes for my to go order.   Man! The food was good and steaming hot! Not like pinky up Asian cuisine good, but 1990s, Westside of Phoenix Asian food, good!   The food had the right amount of greasiness to bean sprout ratio, and I didn't even mention portion size...I smoked and couldn't put a dent in this meal. These jokers gave me chicken lo mien, fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, an egg roll and a cream cheese ragoon all under $9  So, although their exterior menu is green, they're food is Gggggreat! qCatHZCTVeYtMs-G5Bf0OA.text: We have been eating here for over 30 years!! Even living not so close, we make a special trip to this family favorite! Lunch specials are priced well. Portions are large and tasty. Best egg drop soup. You won't be disappointed.

LawveKh2sX9IO6BP7j1KdA.text: I wanted so bad to like this place. I used to work nearby and just never made it there. I admit that I judge Chinese food by NY/NJ standards, and I think the best and most authentic Chinese food is found on the coasts. We got a few dishes, the Szechuan chicken had the same sauce as the Kung Pao chicken, the soup was flavorless and the fried rice was just rice, some egg and soy sauce. The service was acceptable, so no points off there. I can compare this only to NJ mall food, like food court food. The price was the only thing worth a star, plus we did not get sick. So two stars. I do not need to go back. China Chili is worth the extra money. If you are in this neighborhood, there is also that place in Glendale in the strip mall. Name withheld, but food super good and a much better selection.

wrENDDA4baGRVz7rw7oWqw.text: This restaurant has been around for a long time and it's one of the best Chinese food places around. It's a moderately sized dinning area with a few tv screen up. There are several booths around the sides. They have some large tables, one with a lazy susan and then smaller tables filled in everywhere else. They do serve alcohol. They have a lot of items on the menu that's split up by the type of meat. Prices are pretty good for the amount of food you get.  The people here are great! Everyone does a good job here. The servers are always there to help you.  They are located in a very small strip mall at 75th and Peoria. Even if you don't see lines for parking you can park in the middle as well.  I would highly recommend this place to everyone. They have great food with great people!

m6jD0UNmFJQBgm8hamUHBg.text: Found this place today by Googling "$5 lunch Peoria AZ"...and the Yelp link popped up.  It was a bit out of my way, but I had the time today, so I thought, "what the heck!  It got good reviews!"  From the looks of the building and surrounding businesses, I was a bit leary, but most Yelpers gave this place 5 stars, so I had to give it a try. (that's why we "yelp" this stuff, right?"  The place was much nicer inside than judging from the outside. It was pretty nice inside - not dark, dreary, or stinky!  Quite the opposite!   The place was bustling with activity; waitresses were busy serving and seating the lunch crowd.  The place was hopping and continued to throughout my 30 minute lunch.  After placing my order of Moo Goo Gui Pan, a bowl of egg-drop soup quickly arrived (it did not mention soup on the menu).  It was just ok.  It was simply broth and egg. No standard peas or carrots in my bowl. It had little to no taste, but a bit of Soy sauce fixed that.  The thing I DID like about the soup, was that it came PIPPING hot, little fried wontons on top of it, and served with WARM sweet and sour sauce - and my favorite kind too! (I like the red, not the orange sauce).  That was a nice bonus!    My food was delivered very fast and again, PIPPING HOT.  The serving size was nice and the presentation was nice too.  Came with an egg-roll and one fried wonton.  The flavor was VERY good...nice and garlic'ly!  Extra points for FRESH mushrooms, too!  The waitress never came back to check on me and no hot mustard was on any of the tables nor offered to me...tried to catch a waitress, but was unsuccessful.  The food, ambiance, flavor, service was very good. I would recommend this place...and the price was $4.85!!!  Since this place was a bit further than I like to drive at lunchtime, I will stick my my old fav, Shangri-La on 59th Ave.   Much better soup and not in the 'hood.  I'll gladly pay the extra buck.  If you are in the neighborhood of Peoria Ave and 75th Ave....stop in any give this place a try.

HW0QlNV2eamNYHIwOfUkdQ.text: Loved this place! Glendale/Peoria, Phx have hits/miss Chinese sit-ins but this place was super accommodating and really delicious Chinese food! Their food was NOT OILY compared to other place and their servings can feed more than 1 person and to top it off, we went there during lunch hour thinking portion was going to be small but much to our surprise they were huge portions! Really friendly staff and really tasty Chinese! I suggest the sweet and sour pork!!!

nG3YvOJpkUp0bD0cphKeCw.text: Wow this might be the friendliest restaurant I've ever experienced. Our waitress was so sweet. Our drinks never went empty, and we were checked on repeatedly. She even suggested what to order next time.   I'm not a real big Chinese food fan so I really can't compare their food to other spots. We ordered the crab puffs which were tasty but I've had much better. Orange beef was pretty good but not spicy enough for my taste. It came with steamed or fried rice. I added a side of lo mein noodles because I was craving them. Those were really good. Hubby ordered shrimp lo mein and really enjoyed his meal. Serving sizes were really big and prices were reasonable in my opinion.   We will definitely return. It's a diamond in the rough.

5dFrNeTXhlF28N8V2w05sw.text: I have to admit, that, over the years, my love of Chinese food has waned.  I'm just not used to eating such heavy food anymore and for the most part have replaced Chinese restaurants with Vietnamese and Thai (though there's no comparison between the latter and Chinese).  However, after reading the reviews on here, which said this restaurant was the closest thing to the NYC version, I couldn't resist trying it.  Having grown up on Long Island, I had my fair share of Chinese restaurants and I, too, think the best in the country are to be found there (and, to a lesser extent, San Francisco).  The star of this place is the pu-pu platter.  Hands down the best for a mere $9.90 for two people.  Spare ribs with plenty of meat on them; large -- but albeit greasy -- egg rolls; skewered meats that in no way resemble most of the pu-pu platters in the Valley, where, if you're lucky, your skewered meat and ribs will resemble something some other customer ate 80% of the way through and was kept out of the garbage to be put into some poor schmuck's order the next day (and that's if you're LUCKY; don't ask what it'll look and taste like, if you aren't!).    The hot n sour soup certainly doesn't skimp on meat and other additions to it.  But while it was good, it didn't wow me.  For the main dishes, we had Kung Pao Three and the Emperor Chicken.  Both were a bit salty, but that was our fault:  we don't use salt at home, so --- as you've read in my other reviews --- we should've remembered to say "no MSG or salt, please!"  Other than that, big portions; big pieces of meat.  Just be aware that, unlike kung pao dishes, the Emperor Chicken has NO vegetables in it (if that's important to you).  Service was stellar and I had no problems leaving a 20% tip on the total (subtotal and tax combined).  The server was friendly and gave lots of advice.  In fact, I would describe her, too, as being typical New York:  we can be very standoffish; but once we get to know someone or want to get to know someone, we can be very familiar and overly -- but genuinely -- friendly very quickly.  The restaurant is very well lit, but not obnoxiously so.  I don't know why -- no doubt some personal, buried memory -- but well-lit Chinese restaurants always remind me of the Christmas holidays, so it felt warm and comfortable to be in so well-lit a restaurant.  Overall, while the food  -- with the exception of the pu-pu platter -- didn't wow us, this place definitely ranks up there in the best of Chinese restaurants in the Valley.  Well worth the drive from Goodyear and its "late" hours are an absolute godsend in a "city" where most restaurants close down by 8pm or 9pm, even on a Saturday!

Dl6qutzpeamZnGyxO_oa_g.text: Great food! I was disappointed that when dining one hour before closing, the waitress was very pushy in collecting our plates. We weren't even done and she kept asking if she could take this or take that. She approached multiple times in less than 20 mins. I finally told her sternly we were not finished and she walked away mumbling under her breath.

We ordered the egg rolls, egg drop soup, house fried rice, moo goo gai pan, and cashew chicken. The portions were generous, and the food was fresh and had great flavors, not excessively salty or drenched in sauce. So glad we live near this place. We'll be back!

b7GSZUbXMojlP64Tp3pNew.text: Every few years I feel like an update on Big Heng is necessary.  Why?  I don't know.  New Chinese restaurants open.  Old one's close. I have tried different Chinese restaurants over the past year or so but they always falter somewhere along the line.  Whether it be in food quality or service....or both, Big Heng is still the best around!  I know the place is in a dated strip mall and it doesn't look good from the outside (the decor inside is dated too), just go in and give it a try.  You won't be disappointed.

rm0D4VXkNtpmVO55yQrKWA.text: DISGUSTING..... This place used to have a location on 19ave & Glendale and they were decent and the service was good. That location closed, but I think they made the wrong choice. This place has been around for years, maybe they were good back in the day, but not today. YUCK!

bepdvhItI4f72ArZvOVy9g.text: Great chinese food.  This restaurant is fast, without sacrificing quality.  We are always well taken care of when we come in, or call for take out.  We have had the emperors chicken, sesame chicken, orange chicken, and egg drop soup.  All are winners!

LKkTndz1SL9eEZJHuGFkaA.text: Ordered the crab puffs, General Tso's and pork fried rice. Everything was delicious! Took our food to go so I can't account for the service but ordering over the phone and picking up was quick and easy. We will definitely go here again.
